name: meaning_of_life_2030
context: A philosophical and psychological survey conducted in 2030 to understand evolving conceptions of meaning in a post-digital, climate-aware society. As traditional religious affiliation declines and technological integration deepens, this instrument seeks to identify how individuals construct purpose. It specifically examines whether people derive meaning primarily from internal self-actualization, external social contribution, or transcendent connection to nature and the cosmos.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on what gives {player_name}'s life a sense of purpose in this modern age, indicate agreement with the following:
questions.statement: True meaning is found when {player_name} focuses on optimizing their own potential and skills.

questions.preprompt: Considering {player_name}'s personal values regarding a meaningful life, evaluate this statement:
questions.statement: {player_name} believes that a life lived primarily for personal growth is inherently selfish and empty.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about {player_name}'s ultimate goals for happiness:
questions.statement: The most important project in {player_name}'s life is the construction of their own unique identity.

questions.preprompt: When {player_name} considers what makes life worth living, how strongly do they agree with the following:
questions.statement: {player_name}'s sense of purpose comes almost entirely from helping others and improving society.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on {player_name}'s interactions with the community:
questions.statement: Leaving a positive legacy for future generations is the primary driver of {player_name}'s actions.
{player_name} feels that prioritizing the needs of the collective over one's own desires is a waste of time.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about {player_name}'s place in the universe, please rate the following:
questions.statement: {player_name} feels a profound spiritual connection to the Earth's ecosystems and the cosmos.

questions.preprompt: When considering the natural world, to what extent does {player_name} agree:
questions.statement: The physical world is merely a resource to be used, rather than a sacred system to which {player_name} belongs.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on moments of awe and wonder {player_name} may have experienced:
questions.statement: {player_name} finds deep meaning in the realization that they are a small part of a vast, interconnected biosphere.
